class_notes: This course will consider the latest issues pertaining to rapidly accelerating technologies, their social impact, and their consequences for governance. We'll take a comparative perspective, with examples from the Americas, Europe and Asia.  We'll begin with the history of technologies & public perceptions of technology, including ancient technologies, with students visiting The Carlos Museum. Topics covered in the course will include artificial intelligence; outer space technologies; technology and great power competition; biometric identification and payment systems; surveillance and privacy; crypto & blockchain; automation, robotics, and the future of work; social media and mental health; new political campaigning technologies, climate change & public health technologies; developments in technology law and regulation; as well as technologically-enabled meddling in elections and in the information space, including the impact of bad actors and deep fakes.
course_description: Selected topics and problems in political science. Content will vary in successive offerings of this course. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
